ygData.messageBody:
"As a follow up-- I've recently read that Verant
can not allow us to stack things with charges.
Therefore, in the near future at least, things like poisons
and caster spells will not stack. My question is
then, who are shammys able to stack potions??? Aren't
they items with charges???"<br><br>That's different
actually.<br><br>Here's why... 1) It's a special thing with Shammy
potions and only certain potions. 2) It's not a stack of
charged items... as far as I understand it-- and here's
the fine line<br><br>A sow potion that you're
thinking of as a "stack" is a 10 charge sow potion created
using an item called something like a Bear Skin potion
bag. (forget the exact name. Nice tailored
item)<br><br>Fine line I agree. But it's why you can have say--a
sword with a right click 5 charge-- but can't get it to
stack. Cause well-- it's a sword. In order for them to
stack things with charges, swords with charges might
end up kinda weird. (Just a hunch from what they've
said)<br><br>I see no reason why they couldn't just make a vial
of poison a multi charged item though. Give ya'll
like a Poison Bag like the shaman have and make only
certain poisons combinable (they don't want you to have
too much of certain poisons).<br><br>shooman
out<br>Fatedhue Prismatic<br><br>PS... probably it's a matter of
man power. They're working on a lot of stuff since
SoL came out and if you were to post it on some
Verant boards-- they might get started on it.<br><br>But
in order to do that, they'd have to get all the
poison code-- figure out how they'd like the charge
additions and tailoring would make a Poison bag, etc etc
etc.<br><br>Saying that they could easily encode doesn't mean it
doesn't mean a lot of work. Just that the theories and
concepts and coding will be easy. Nothing new to design.
Easy work in abundance is still time consuming
though.<br><br>PPS... otherwise though, I hope this clarifies your
question
